page.title: 20Offord Cluny
page.content: {Offord}got its name from there being a ford across the river between Buckden and the village. We don't know if the "of" part of Offord means "over the ford" or "upper ford".{Cluny}got its name from the Cluny monks who came to the village after Arnulf de Hesding had presented an estate to the Abbey of Cluny just before 1086. Cluny is a town in Saone-et-Loire in France. All the third-year children of {Brampton Infant School}helped in the research work for this disc. The following children contributed with the writing: Julie Banks, Anne Bradbury, Kevin Briggs, Adrian Brudenell, Peter Danks, Mark Ellis, Richard Ellis, David Flanagan, Rebecca Garvey, Alex Harris, Natasha Larke, Paul Mckeating, Tom McNeill, Lucy Pike Sophia Sledge, Sarah Thane, James Warburton and Helen Womersley.
